result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J. A. Schreck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If sentence is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant shall not enter any establishment in which their primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  No contact with known drug dealers.    No use or consumption of intoxicants.  No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.  Submit DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Dept of Corrections will effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision upon receipt of the order, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining confinement to extended supervision.  The warden/superintendent of the institution shall effect his release upon receipt of the order.
